meanings.definition: Covered with or full of thorny bushes or briers.
meanings.sent1: The path through the forest was briery, making it hard to walk.
meanings.sent2: Her hands got scratched from the briery bushes while hiking.
meanings.sent3: The briery bushes seemed to be playing a game of tag with anyone passing by.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were like navigating through a briery maze, full of obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The briery thorns gleamed in the sunlight, warning of their sharpness.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a brier.
meanings.sent1: The fabric had a briery texture, similar to a rough brier.
meanings.sent2: Her voice had a briery quality, rough but oddly comforting.
meanings.sent3: The briery pattern on the wallpaper gave the room a rustic feel.
meanings.sent4: His briery personality could be prickly at times but also endearing.
meanings.sent5: The briery aroma of the pine forest brought back memories of childhood adventures.
